concept.title: Warnings and Precautions for Cleaning Materials
concept.shortdesc: Cleaning materials and solvents must be tested before you apply them to a typewriter as they may have adverse effects.

li.note: If bubbling, discoloration, or paint stripping occurs, remove the cleaner immediately. A gentler cleaning solution should be tested.
Contact with decals, branding components, and model names should be avoided. Even mild soap and water can remove painted details.
Avoid using mineral spirits on the rubber or soft-plastic components of the typewriter, such as the platen, feeder, and paper-bail rollers. Harsh solvents can degrade rubber.

conbody.note: If key caps, knobs, or other high-touch surfaces have tar buildup, soak in a 3% hydrogen peroxide solution for 4 to 8 hours to remove discoloration.
If the typewriter has steel or aluminum panels, apply car wax according to the product directions to create a glossy finish and prevent rusting.
